item.title: EDST 110 Foundations of Education Theory
item.description: EDST 110 Foundations of Education Theory [[2022-09-01]] [[Critical Race Theory]] Why are parents upset? They are offended that race is being taught in schools rather than at home Blaming children as if they’re the probelm Being taught to hate America This is socialism/communism [[2022-08-08 Hoppsibs 2021-2022 sign-up]] The purpose of education is opportunity The tension between education as a public good and education as a private good (Labaree 2018) By the turn of the 20th century, schooling was still regarded mainly as a public good, but the mission had begun to shift from politics (creating citizens) to economics (training capable workers who can help promote broad prosperity).

item.title: How I Overcame My Cockroach Fear
item.description: How I Overcame My Cockroach Fear I forced myself to pick a dead one in the bathroom with a bunch of paper towels.

item.title: PSYC 126 Attraction and Relationships
item.description: PSYC 126 Attraction and Relationships Lecture 1 September 2nd, 2021 Attachment Goals Discuss the basic research process in the field of psychology Define, describe, and apply a broad range of close relationship psychology theories Critically evaluate psyc findings Harry Harlow Rhesus monkeys raised in social isolation and reared on two mothers wire mother↔is not cozy cloth mother↔is cozy Previous assumption↔love is about survival An extreme position, made popular by psychologists like John Watson, held that young children should never be caressed, held or physically comforted by parents Harlow demolished behaviorism’s claim that infant attachment depends on food.

item.title: Face-Name Matching Effect
item.description: Face-Name Matching Effect People chose Dan, the correct answer, 40% of the time rather than 25% of the time (1 out of 4 options).

item.title: Argue Against the Ideas, Not the Person
item.description: Argue Against the Ideas, Not the Person See [[Arguments Against the Person]] and CMV: In discourse, especially political, one should argue against their opposite’s viewpoint and ideas and not against the person themselves.

item.title: Why Younger Siblings Dominate Sports
item.description: Why Younger Siblings Dominate Sports Competing with older siblings, who often overpower them physically, challenges younger siblings to think critically and creatively to find ways to win.

item.title: Availability Heuristic

item.title: Rage as a Response to Cheating
item.description: Rage as a Response to Cheating If you responded with [[Rage]] because someone was [[Cheating]] and they replied, “being [[Angry]] only makes me more likely to cheat so why are you doing it,” you would be further enraged.

item.title: Why Would the Brain Evolve or Keep Such a Self Destructive Behavior?
item.description: Why Would the Brain Evolve or Keep Such a Self Destructive Behavior? Instead, we get a rapid response to the [[Amigdala]].

item.title: The Winner Effect
item.description: The Winner Effect Mike Tyson anecdote, return from prison A [[Tomato Can]] is used in sports to build confidence Tyson beat two really easy opponents, then became the best again Success increases testosterone, failure decreases testosterone, [[Fake it Until You Make it]].
